thread.title: Panthers LB Kuechly to miss 3rd game with concussion
thread.title_full: Panthers LB Kuechly to miss 3rd game with concussion

title: Panthers LB Kuechly to miss 3rd game with concussion
text:
Panthers LB Kuechly to miss 3rd game with concussion 
Posted 1:02 p.m. today Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * Are you human? * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters 
CHARLOTTE, N.C. â€” Panthers middle linebacker Luke Kuechly will miss his third straight game Sunday against Tampa Bay with a concussion. 
Coach Ron Rivera listed Kuechly as out Friday on the team's injury report, along with wide receiver Jerricho Cotchery (ankle) and offensive linemen Amini Silatolu (ankle) and Daryl Williams (knee). 
Running back Jonathan Stewart (tibia) and fullback Mike Tolbert (groin) practiced Friday and are listed as probable. 
Kuechly was injured in the second quarter of Carolina's season opener at Jacksonville when he collided with Jaguars running back T.J. Yeldon on a tackle. He hasn't practiced or played since. 
Still, the Panthers (3-0) are managing OK so far without the 2013 NFL Defensive Player of the Year. Carolina has a bye next week, so Kuechly will have had four weeks off to rest. 
___
